sentences.en: an imposing town hall, erected in 1892
sentences.cn: 一座气势宏伟的市政厅，建于1892年
动物发怒时鬃毛会竖起.
七十五岁了,他的身躯还是挺直的.

sentences.en: He sat very erect, listening intently.
sentences.cn: 他坐得笔直, 专心地听.

sentences.en: He walked at a rapid pace with his back straight and his head held erect.
sentences.cn: 他昂首挺胸地快步而行。

sentences.en: Her legs were long and fine, her hips slender, her carriage erect.
Hold the upper back and neck in an erect position to give support for the head.
sentences.cn: 挺直上背部和脖子来支撑头部。

sentences.en: It took a couple of hours to erect the tent.
Martin stood erect on the platform.
sentences.cn: 马丁在讲台上笔直地站着。

sentences.en: Police have erected barriers across the main roads into the town.
sentences.cn: 警察在进城的主要道路上设立了路障。

sentences.en: Several pine trees stand erect on the hillside.
sentences.cn: 几棵青松挺立在山坡上.

sentences.en: She held her head erect and her back straight.
sentences.cn: 她昂着头,把背挺得笔直.

sentences.en: Six policemen started to erect a roadblock.
sentences.cn: 六个警察着手建立一道路障.

sentences.en: Stand reasonably erect, your arms hanging naturally.
sentences.cn: 挺身站直，双臂自然下垂。

sentences.en: Stand with your arms by your side and your head erect.

sentences.cn: 那儿有一棵挺拔的松树.

trans.tran_en: to build something such as a building or wall
to build something such as a building or wall
